root_causes: Script references variable B5cDKx5 but expected variable is B5cDKx5_99 (wrong variable name).

Use of any(B5cDKx5,99) is inappropriate if the actual variable is the single sub-variable B5cDKx5_99; this both uses the wrong variable and an any() call that implies a vector when there is a single target variable.
instructions: Change all occurrences of B5cDKx5 to the correct sub-variable name B5cDKx5_99.
Use a direct check against B5cDKx5_99 rather than any() for a single sub-variable. For example: sel if miss(B5cDKx5_99) or B5cDKx5_99 <> 99.

If B5cDKx5 is actually a vector of sub-variables, ensure you target the specific sub-variable that holds code 99 (B5cDKx5_99) or use any() over the correct list of sub-variables (e.g. any(B5cDKx5_1, B5cDKx5_2, B5cDKx5_99, 99)).

root_causes: Incorrect variable referenced: generated script uses B5cDKx5 but expected sub-question variable is B5cDKx5_99.
Selection logic targets the wrong variable scope. The code uses any(B5cDKx5,99) on the top-level name instead of checking the specific sub-variable B5cDKx5_99.
instructions: Reference the correct variable name B5cDKx5_99 (the sub-question) instead of B5cDKx5.
Use an appropriate check for the sub-variable. For example: sel if miss(B5cDKx5_99) or B5cDKx5_99 <> 99 (or sel if miss(B5cDKx5_99) or ~any(B5cDKx5_99,99)) depending on how the sub-variable is coded.

If the intent is to flag respondents who did not select the '99' option, keep the 'or ... <> 99' logic; if the intent is to only flag invalid codes, ensure the test matches the actual coded values for B5cDKx5_99.

root_causes: Missing allowance for NotRequired: script incorrectly flags missing values by including miss(v) in the selection condition even though the field is NotRequired.
Custom validation specified in expected logic (validateB5d("S7_1","B5dx1_4","hDUMB5dCol1_2","B5dDKx1")) is not implemented; cross-field validation is absent.
instructions: Do not flag missing values for these NotRequired open-text numeric fields. Replace the selection condition so only out-of-range numeric values are flagged. For example, use: sel if ~range(v,0,9999).

Implement the custom cross-field validation validateB5d(...) as specified. Add an additional selection step (or macro call) that evaluates validateB5d("S7_1","B5dx1_4","hDUMB5dCol1_2","B5dDKx1") and selects/list respondents where that validation fails.
Ensure the numeric range check remains inclusive of 0 and 9999 and accepts the variable precision (range(v,0,9999) is appropriate for that).

root_causes: Missing allowance for NotRequired: script flags missing values by using miss(v) in the selection condition even though the field is NotRequired.
Custom cross-field validation validateB5d("S7_2","B5dx2_4","hDUMB5dCol2_2","B5dDKx2") from the expected logic is not implemented.
instructions: Remove miss(v) from the selection condition so missing entries are not flagged. Use: sel if ~range(v,0,9999) to flag only values outside the allowed range.
Add the specified validateB5d("S7_2","B5dx2_4","hDUMB5dCol2_2","B5dDKx2") cross-field validation step and select/list respondents where that validation fails.
Keep the inclusive numeric bounds (0 to 9999) and ensure numeric precision is supported.

root_causes: Missing allowance for NotRequired: generated code flags missing values (miss(v) included) though fields are NotRequired and should allow missing.
The expected custom validation validateB5d("S7_3","B5dx3_4","hDUMB5dCol3_2","B5dDKx3") is not present in the generated script.
instructions: Do not include miss(v) in the selection condition; only flag values outside the allowed numeric range. For example: sel if ~range(v,0,9999).
Implement the required validateB5d("S7_3","B5dx3_4","hDUMB5dCol3_2","B5dDKx3") cross-field validation and select respondents who fail that validation.
Ensure the numeric range check remains inclusive of 0 and 9999 and compatible with the specified precision.
